title: Portfolio Website
subtitle: Personal
desc: In this project, I used Vite for the development and Github for the deployment. I made the design minimalist combined with more Intricate animations to develop my Framer Motion skills, specifically with variants and spring animation. My ReactJs skills also increased, delving into props and components from which I'm eager to learn more about it.

title: Cognitive test
subtitle: Web Game
desc: Here I coded three simple web-based games on cognitive skills. This project was a thrilling challenge for me where I have to use my logical thinking and game designing skills to bring these game concepts to life. I made difficulty curves and the visuals for each game and I utilized AI to create some of the algorithms I put in. I also learned about local storage to store variables for highscore tracking.

title: The Herb Shop (ongoing)
subtitle: E-Commerce
desc: In this project, I led a team of 6 where I hand out tasks to my team members and oversee their progress. I've completed the UI/UX design and now we've started on the development. I'm working on the frontend but I'm also planning to help our backend members on their tasks along the way. Here we're developing a Laravel website where we use its built-in features such as the MVC (Model View Controller) architecture.

title: Polyminal (ongoing)
subtitle: Infographic
desc: Polyminal is a university project in which I lead a team of 5 to create an infographic website about 3D shapes. Our plan is to include descriptions and facts about these shapes. We're using Vite ReactJS to develop the website and intend to use R3F for the 3D elements. So far, I've learned about dynamic components using props and array maps.

title: Cellular Automata
subtitle: Experiment
desc: In this website, I created a cell simulation inspired by Conway's Game of Life. I visualized the  iterations and result of the simulation using HTML's canvas element. With JavaScript, I programmed the cell behaviors to simulate a cave formation. I also made user inputs in HTML to control noise density, generate noise maps, and initiate the simulation.

title: Bils Links
subtitle: Link Tree
desc: Here I designed a personalized link tree clone website for a coffee shop. It Featured links for their menus, locations, and social medias. I implemented simple scroll animations using JavaScript and now I realize that using pure JavaScript for animations is not that good. I also deployed this website using Netlify.

title: Jambo
subtitle: Uni Project
desc: In this team project, I took charge of the backend tasks and helped work on the database. I focused on implementing login and registration features for the website.  I didn't really do a good job here because I didn't fully display all the information from the database on the website. But I did connect the database with the backend using expressjs and connect the backend to the frontend using get and post requests in Nodejs.

title: Chocs
subtitle: Uni Project
desc: Chocs is one of my early projects I created with a good friend of mine. I explored more into web development and expanded my knowledge in responsive design using CSS Media Queries. Me and my friend also learned how to use GitHub for easier teamwork. The code and design wasn't good but it helped me learn more and get to where I am today.

title: Yamada
subtitle: Uni Project
desc: This project is one of my first website projects. Here I learned HTML and CSS, specifically classes to apply styles from the css and various types of html elements (turns out they're all just fancy divs). The final product was not that good but it was one of my early steps into the world of web development.
